FUTURE WORLD, ArtScience Museum Singapore
Data Publication for the 2021 Artificial Intelligence, Morality, and Sentience (AIMS) Survey
Janet Pauketat
Research Fellow
March 23, 2022

This blog post was edited by Ali Ladak and Jacy Reese Anthis. The 2021 AIMS survey was designed by Janet Pauketat, Jamie Harris, Ali Ladak, and Jacy Reese Anthis. The data was collected and analyzed by Janet Pauketat, Ali Ladak, and Jacy Reese Anthis. Many thanks to Jamie Harris for his contribution to the survey design and project development and to David Moss, Zan (Alexander) Saeri, and Daniel Shank for their feedback on our methodology.

To cite the  2021 AIMS respondents could select “No opinion” for four of these questions, all except for the Possibility of AI Sentience. The census-balanced “No opinion” response rates were 16.86% for Ban on AI Sentience, 14.49% for Legal Rights for AI, 11.87% for AI Welfare Importance, and 9.50% for AI Threat to Future People.
